verses.verse: How <WH349> doth the city<WH5892> sit<WH3427> solitary,<WH910> that was full<WH7227> of people!<WH5971> how is she become<WH1961> as a widow!<WH490> she that was great<WH7227> among the nations,<WH1471> and princess<WH8282> among the provinces,<WH4082> how is she become<WH1961> tributary!<WH4522>

She weepeth sore<WH1058> <WH1058> in the night,<WH3915> and her tears<WH1832> are on<WH5921> her cheeks:<WH3895> among all<WH4480> <WH3605> her lovers<WH157> she hath none<WH369> to comfort<WH5162> her: all<WH3605> her friends<WH7453> have dealt treacherously<WH898> with her, they are become<WH1961> her enemies.<WH341>

Judah <WH3063> is gone into captivity<WH1540> because of affliction,<WH4480> <WH6040> and because of great<WH4480> <WH7230> servitude:<WH5656> she<WH1931> dwelleth<WH3427> among the heathen,<WH1471> she findeth<WH4672> no<WH3808> rest:<WH4494> all<WH3605> her persecutors<WH7291> overtook<WH5381> her between<WH996> the straits.<WH4712>

The ways<WH1870> of Zion<WH6726> do mourn,<WH57> because none<WH4480> <WH1097> come<WH935> to the solemn feasts:<WH4150> all<WH3605> her gates<WH8179> are desolate:<WH8074> her priests<WH3548> sigh,<WH584> her virgins<WH1330> are afflicted,<WH3013> and she<WH1931> is in bitterness.<WH4843>

Her adversaries<WH6862> are<WH1961> the chief,<WH7218> her enemies<WH341> prosper;<WH7951> for<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> hath afflicted<WH3013> her for<WH5921> the multitude<WH7230> of her transgressions:<WH6588> her children<WH5768> are gone<WH1980> into captivity<WH7628> before<WH6440> the enemy.<WH6862>

And from<WH4480> the daughter<WH1323> of Zion<WH6726> all<WH3605> her beauty<WH1926> is departed:<WH3318> her princes<WH8269> are become<WH1961> like harts<WH354> that find<WH4672> no<WH3808> pasture,<WH4829> and they are gone<WH1980> without<WH3808> strength<WH3581> before<WH6440> the pursuer.<WH7291>

Jerusalem <WH3389> remembered<WH2142> in the days<WH3117> of her affliction<WH6040> and of her miseries<WH4788> all<WH3605> her pleasant things<WH4262> that<WH834> she had<WH1961> in the days<WH4480> <WH3117> of old,<WH6924> when her people<WH5971> fell<WH5307> into the hand<WH3027> of the enemy,<WH6862> and none<WH369> did help<WH5826> her: the adversaries<WH6862> saw<WH7200> her, and did mock<WH7832> at<WH5921> her sabbaths.<WH4868>

Jerusalem <WH3389> hath grievously sinned;<WH2398> <WH2399> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> she is<WH1961> removed:<WH5206> all<WH3605> that honored<WH3513> her despise<WH2151> her, because<WH3588> they have seen<WH7200> her nakedness:<WH6172> yea,<WH1571> she<WH1931> sigheth,<WH584> and turneth<WH7725> backward.<WH268>

Her filthiness<WH2932> is in her skirts;<WH7757> she remembereth<WH2142> not<WH3808> her last end;<WH319> therefore she came down<WH3381> wonderfully:<WH6382> she had no<WH369> comforter.<WH5162> O LORD,<WH3068> behold<WH7200> <WH853> my affliction:<WH6040> for<WH3588> the enemy<WH341> hath magnified<WH1431> himself.

The adversary<WH6862> hath spread out<WH6566> his hand<WH3027> upon<WH5921> all<WH3605> her pleasant things:<WH4261> for<WH3588> she hath seen<WH7200> that the heathen<WH1471> entered<WH935> into her sanctuary,<WH4720> whom<WH834> thou didst command<WH6680> that they should not<WH3808> enter<WH935> into thy congregation.<WH6951>

All <WH3605> her people<WH5971> sigh,<WH584> they seek<WH1245> bread;<WH3899> they have given<WH5414> their pleasant things<WH4262> for meat<WH400> to relieve<WH7725> the soul:<WH5315> see,<WH7200> O LORD,<WH3068> and consider;<WH5027> for<WH3588> I am become<WH1961> vile.<WH2151>

Is it nothing<WH3808> to<WH413> you, all<WH3605> ye that pass by?<WH5674> <WH1870> behold,<WH5027> and see<WH7200> if<WH518> there be<WH3426> any sorrow<WH4341> like unto my sorrow,<WH4341> which<WH834> is done<WH5953> unto me, wherewith<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> hath afflicted<WH3013> me in the day<WH3117> of his fierce<WH2740> anger.<WH639>

From above<WH4480> <WH4791> hath he sent<WH7971> fire<WH784> into my bones,<WH6106> and it prevaileth against<WH7287> them: he hath spread<WH6566> a net<WH7568> for my feet,<WH7272> he hath turned<WH7725> me back:<WH268> he hath made<WH5414> me desolate<WH8074> and faint<WH1739> all<WH3605> the day.<WH3117>

The yoke<WH5923> of my transgressions<WH6588> is bound<WH8244> by his hand:<WH3027> they are wreathed,<WH8276> and come up<WH5927> upon<WH5921> my neck:<WH6677> he hath made my strength<WH3581> to fall,<WH3782> the Lord<WH136> hath delivered<WH5414> me into their hands,<WH3027> from whom I am not able<WH3201> <WH3808> to rise up.<WH6965>

The Lord<WH136> hath trodden under foot<WH5541> all<WH3605> my mighty<WH47> men in the midst<WH7130> of me: he hath called<WH7121> an assembly<WH4150> against<WH5921> me to crush<WH7665> my young men:<WH970> the Lord<WH136> hath trodden<WH1869> the virgin,<WH1330> the daughter<WH1323> of Judah,<WH3063> as in a winepress.<WH1660>

For <WH5921> these<WH428> things I<WH589> weep;<WH1058> mine eye,<WH5869> mine eye<WH5869> runneth down<WH3381> with water,<WH4325> because<WH3588> the comforter<WH5162> that should relieve<WH7725> my soul<WH5315> is far<WH7368> from<WH4480> me: my children<WH1121> are<WH1961> desolate,<WH8074> because<WH3588> the enemy<WH341> prevailed.<WH1396>

Zion <WH6726> spreadeth forth<WH6566> her hands,<WH3027> and there is none<WH369> to comfort<WH5162> her: the LORD<WH3068> hath commanded<WH6680> concerning Jacob,<WH3290> that his adversaries<WH6862> should be round about<WH5439> him: Jerusalem<WH3389> is<WH1961> as a menstruous woman<WH5079> among<WH996> them.

The LORD<WH3068> is righteous;<WH6662> for<WH3588> I have rebelled<WH4784> against his commandment:<WH6310> hear,<WH8085> I pray you,<WH4994> all<WH3605> people,<WH5971> and behold<WH7200> my sorrow:<WH4341> my virgins<WH1330> and my young men<WH970> are gone<WH1980> into captivity.<WH7628>

I called<WH7121> for my lovers,<WH157> but they<WH1992> deceived<WH7411> me: my priests<WH3548> and mine elders<WH2205> gave up the ghost<WH1478> in the city,<WH5892> while<WH3588> they sought<WH1245> their meat<WH400> to relieve<WH7725> <WH853> their souls.<WH5315>

Behold, <WH7200> O LORD;<WH3068> for<WH3588> I am in distress:<WH6862> my bowels<WH4578> are troubled;<WH2560> mine heart<WH3820> is turned<WH2015> within<WH7130> me; for<WH3588> I have grievously rebelled:<WH4784> <WH4784> abroad<WH4480> <WH2351> the sword<WH2719> bereaveth,<WH7921> at home<WH1004> there is as death.<WH4194>

They have heard<WH8085> that<WH3588> I<WH589> sigh:<WH584> there is none<WH369> to comfort<WH5162> me: all<WH3605> mine enemies<WH341> have heard<WH8085> of my trouble;<WH7451> they are glad<WH7797> that<WH3588> thou<WH859> hast done<WH6213> it: thou wilt bring<WH935> the day<WH3117> that thou hast called,<WH7121> and they shall be<WH1961> like unto me.<WH3644>

Let all<WH3605> their wickedness<WH7451> come<WH935> before<WH6440> thee; and do<WH5953> unto them, as<WH834> thou hast done<WH5953> unto me for<WH5921> all<WH3605> my transgressions:<WH6588> for<WH3588> my sighs<WH585> are many,<WH7227> and my heart<WH3820> is faint.<WH1742>
